poem:
**Morning Echoes**

Shelley, star-dusted in Texas dust,
the door creaks, whispers
from 1980 echo, a scream 
pinned in celluloid memory.

Felissa stands trembling
in the ghost-light of legacy,
a meeting in December's stillness,
shadowed past, present fright.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘She’d never done anything like this before’: behind the scenes on Shelley Duvall’s extraordinary final film Felissa Rose is America’s modern day “scream queen”; at 55, the veteran of 150 movies, most of them horror. But she was, she says, genuinely frightened knocking on the front door of the Texas home owned by Shelley Duvall. It was December 2022, and Duvall, star of one of the most acclaimed horror films of all time – Stanley". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: ‘She’d never done anything like this before’: behind the scenes on Shelley Duvall’s extraordinary final film Felissa Rose is America’s modern day “scream queen”; at 55, the veteran of 150 movies, most of them horror. But she was, she says, genuinely frightened knocking on the front door of the Texas home owned by Shelley Duvall. It was December 2022, and Duvall, star of one of the most acclaimed horror films of all time – Stanley
